title: 103_hr4178
content: The "Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994" includes amendments regarding the treatment of administrative costs for direct and guaranteed loans, as well as the reporting of administrative costs in the President's annual budget submission. SEC. 4 of the Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 introduces definitions and calculations for Federal Credit Subsidy Rates, including maximum rates under SEC. 508. SEC. 508 of the Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 sets maximum federal credit subsidy rates for covered programs, with rates decreasing over fiscal years from 40% in 1995 to 5% in 1999. The subsidy rates are determined based on estimates by the Director of the Congressional Budget Office. The Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 establishes maximum federal credit subsidy rates for covered programs, with rates decreasing annually. Amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 prohibit breaching the maximum subsidy rate and allocate total credit authority accordingly. Amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 establish guidelines for total credit authority allocation to prevent breaching maximum subsidy rates for covered programs. The Act and its amendments will be effective for fiscal years starting after the enactment date.
